definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The mother ptarmigan beat about him with great outcry.
sentences.chinese: 母鸡大吵大叫地朝他扑打过来。

sentences.english: The bird beat its wings against the bars of its cage.
sentences.chinese: 鸟用翅膀扑打着鸟笼的栏杆。

sentences.english: When he flapped his wings, a cloud of grey ash filled the air.
sentences.chinese: 当他扑打双翼时，一团灰烬弥漫在空气里。

sentences.english: Second, seal your look with a fine dusting of loose face powder.
sentences.chinese: 第二，适当扑打一些轻柔碎粉，以保护你的脸部。

sentences.english: My wings beat in a frenzy, but the Grail would not move.
sentences.chinese: 我的翅膀疯狂地扑打着，圣杯却纹丝不动。

sentences.english: The bird fluttered its wings wildly but it could not get off the ground.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿拼命扑打着翅膀，但仍不能飞离地面。

sentences.english: The sea dashed against the rock, and covered them with spray.
sentences.chinese: 海浪扑打着岩石，浪花飞溅到他们全身。

definition: to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
